intro: Banisteria tenuis, commonly known as the small-stemmed banisteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bignoniaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, elongated fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
